description: From Latin vacillātum, supine form of vacillō (“sway, waver”).

verbs.description: vacillate (third-person singular simple present vacillates, present participle vacillating, simple past and past participle vacillated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To sway unsteadily from one side to the other; oscillate.
(intransitive) To swing indecisively from one course of action or opinion to another.
